statement:
[**.**]{} A finite ring is cyclic if and only if its and characteristic
are equal.

If $R$ is a cyclic ring and $r$ is a of the additive group of $R$, then
$|r|=|R|$. Since, for every $s \in R$, $|s|$ divides $|R|$, then it
follows that $\operatorname{char}~R=|R|$. Conversely, if $R$ is a finite
ring such that $\operatorname{char}~R=|R|$, then the exponent of the
additive group of $R$ is also equal to $|R|$. Thus, there exists
$t \in R$ such that $|t|=|R|$. Since $\langle t \rangle$ is a subgroup
of the additive group of $R$ and $|\langle t \rangle |=|t|=|R|$, it
follows that $R$ is a cyclic ring.
names: a finite ring is cyclic if and only its order and characteristic are equal
